about.name: Reykjavik
about.info_text: Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland, is a city of natural beauty, cultural vibrancy, and unique charm. Located on the southwest coast of Iceland, Reykjavik is the world's northernmost capital and offers a gateway to the country's stunning landscapes. Visitors can explore the city's colorful buildings, lively arts scene, and rich history. Reykjavik is also known for its geothermal pools and spas, making it an ideal place to relax and rejuvenate. Whether you're looking to experience Iceland's unique culture or use Reykjavik as a starting point for your Icelandic adventure, this city has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 130,000
Country: Iceland
Time Zone: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT+0)
Language: Icelandic, English
Currency: Icelandic Krona (ISK)
about.climate_text: Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland, experiences a subarctic climate with cold winters and cool summers. Winter temperatures in Reykjavik range from -2°C to 2°C (28°F to 36°F), while summer temperatures typically fall between 10°C and 15°C (50°F to 59°F). Precipitation is relatively consistent throughout the year, with frequent rainfall and occasional snowfall during the winter months.

attractions_card.title: Hallgrímskirkja
attractions_card.description: Visit the iconic Hallgrímskirkja church, offering panoramic views of Reykjavik from its observation tower.

attractions_card.title: Harpa Concert Hall
attractions_card.description: Explore the stunning Harpa Concert Hall and Conference Centre, known for its modern architecture and cultural events.

attractions_card.title: Blue Lagoon
attractions_card.description: Relax in the famous Blue Lagoon geothermal spa, surrounded by lava fields and offering warm, mineral-rich waters.

attractions_card.title: Golden Circle
attractions_card.description: Embark on a tour of the Golden Circle, featuring attractions like Geysir geothermal area, Gullfoss waterfall, and Thingvellir National Park.

food_card.title: Icelandic Lamb
food_card.description: Savor traditional Icelandic lamb dishes, known for their tender and flavorful meat.

food_card.title: Plokkfiskur
food_card.description: Try Plokkfiskur, an Icelandic fish stew made with cod or haddock, potatoes, and béchamel sauce.

food_card.title: Skyr
food_card.description: Enjoy Skyr, an Icelandic yogurt-like dairy product that's often served with fruits and honey.

hotels_card.title: Ion Adventure Hotel
hotels_card.description: Stay at the Ion Adventure Hotel, a stylish eco-friendly hotel with breathtaking views of Iceland's natural wonders.

hotels_card.title: CenterHotel Thingholt
hotels_card.description: Experience modern comfort at CenterHotel Thingholt, located in the heart of Reykjavik's city center.

hotels_card.title: Fosshotel Reykjavik
hotels_card.description: Relax at the Fosshotel Reykjavik, a contemporary hotel offering great amenities and proximity to the city's attractions.

transport_card.title: Reykjavik Domestic Airport
transport_card.description: Fly into Reykjavik Domestic Airport for domestic flights and easy access to other parts of Iceland.

transport_card.title: Reykjavik Excursions
transport_card.description: Use Reykjavik Excursions for convenient transportation options, including airport transfers and tours.
